inlineContent.text: A 4-element structure that can be used to represent 4D grid coordinates or any other quadruplet of integers.
It uses integer coordinates and is therefore preferable to
when exact precision is required. Note that the values are limited to 32 bits, and unlike
this cannot be configured with an engine build option. Use integer or
In a boolean context, a Vector4i will evaluate to
. Otherwise, a Vector4i will always evaluate to

Compares two
vectors by first checking if the X value of the left vector is less than the X value of the

vector. If the X values are exactly equal, then it repeats this check with the Y values of the two vectors, Z values of the two vectors, and then with the W values. This operator is useful for sorting vectors.

Types that conform to VariantRepresentable can be stored directly in
with no conversion.  These include all of the Variant types from Godot (for

), Godot objects (those that subclass
SwiftGodot.Object) as well as the built-in Swift types UInt8, Int64 and Double.

Returns the negative value of the Vector4i. This is the same as writing Vector4i(-v.x, -v.y, -v.z, -v.w). This operation flips the direction of the vector while keeping the same magnitude.
